flow.descriptionCdata:
9646d097-b959-4dc4-bc7c-3d4edc7fe72b.0ceb0219-a25c-44cc-a79b-dcf88da2c9a5.prompt=Enter a value for softwarePoliciesIDs 9646d097-b959-4dc4-bc7c-3d4edc7fe72b.0d0dd8fe-ad98-4d83-b259-9fde06e472d6.description=Sleeps for "X" seconds. 
Inputs\:
seconds - The number of seconds to sleep.

Responses\:
success - Slept for "X" seconds.
failure - was unable to sleep for some reason
9646d097-b959-4dc4-bc7c-3d4edc7fe72b.15ed6d90-87ba-44aa-a78d-91a66a95d907.description=
Check to see if the value stored in a specified flow variable, denoted by key, is null.

Inputs\:
keyName - The key to check, i.e. the name of the flow variable.

Returns\: 
The value in the specified key, i.e. flow variable.

Responses\:
isNull - If the key is a null pointer, i.e. the flow variable doesn't have an assigned value.
notNull - If some value is stored in the key, i.e the flow variable has a value assigned.
9646d097-b959-4dc4-bc7c-3d4edc7fe72b.265c14ae-7fc5-47c9-b784-911b10952fbd.description=Starts a remediation on the given server using a set of attached/detached software policies. If the software policies information is not provided, then a full software policy remediation is performed. Inputs\: coreHost - The DNS name or IP Address of your SAS core. corePort - The port to Connect to your SAS core on. coreProtocol - The protocol to connect to your SAS core with. Either HTTP or HTTPS. coreUsername - The username for host. corePassword - The password for host. coreVersion - The version of SAS to use. serverName - The name of the server to remediate. serverId - The ID of the server to remediate. If provided, the server name is ignored. softwarePoliciesNames - The names of the software policies to remediate against (separated by comma). The software policies need to be attached/detached to/from the server before the remediation takes place. softwarePoliciesIDs - The IDs of the software policies to remediate against (separated by comma). The software policies need to be attached/detached to/from the server before the remediation takes place. If this input is provided, then 'softwarePoliciesNames' is ignored. wait - An integer value specifying how many milliseconds should be waited for the job to finish. If not specified the job is started, but may not have finished. rebootOption - Reboot Option for Remediating a server. It could be one of [suppress, per_action, at_end] or it can be left blank. Where\: - suppress - Suppress all reboots; - per_action - Reboot after each installation or uninstallation; - at_end - Reboot at the end of remediation; - left blank (no value provided) - Reboot as specified by individual software items. ticketID - The ticket ID for this job. If not specified it will be set default value\: 'Remediation started by SA user from OO server 'host_address' Responses\: success - The operation completed successfully. failure - Something went wrong. Returns\: returnResult - The id of the created job. 9646d097-b959-4dc4-bc7c-3d4edc7fe72b.28b20d1e-2a68-4e78-ba53-4fa5a6a16741.description=Attaches a software policy to a server/device group/hypervisor. Inputs\: coreHost - The DNS name or IP Address of your SAS core. corePort - The port to Connect to your SAS core on. coreProtocol - The protocol to connect to your SAS core with. Either HTTP or HTTPS. coreUsername - The username for host. corePassword - The password for host. coreVersion - The version of SAS to use. policyName - The name of the policy to attach. policyID - The ID of the policy to attach. If this input is provided, then 'policyName' is ignored. attachableName - The name of the attachable object to attach the policy to. attachableID - The ID of the attachable object to attach the policy to. If this input is provided, then 'attachableName' is ignored. attachableType - The type of the attachable object. Can be\: SERVER, DEVICE_GROUP, HYPERVISOR. Responses\: success - The operation completed successfully. failure - Something went wrong. 9646d097-b959-4dc4-bc7c-3d4edc7fe72b.2df09f21-0fad-4079-89a3-f936bc18308c.description=Waits for the job to reach a specific state. If no state is specified, then this will wait for the job to reach an end state. Inputs\: coreHost - The DNS name or IP Address of your SAS core. corePort - The port to Connect to your SAS core on. coreProtocol - The protocol to connect to your SAS core with. Either HTTP or HTTPS. coreUsername - The username for host. corePassword - The password for host. jobID - the id of the job status - The status to wait for the job to reach. If none is specified this will wait until the job is no longer running. timeout - The maximum number of milliseconds to wait for the job. If not specified, 1 hour is used. Responses\: failure - Something went wrong. success - The operation completed successfully. 9646d097-b959-4dc4-bc7c-3d4edc7fe72b.36e26ec8-a897-4f10-946b-dd0ee506cc91.description=
Check to see if the value stored in a specified flow variable, denoted by key, is null.

Inputs\:
keyName - The key to check, i.e. the name of the flow variable.

Returns\: 
The value in the specified key, i.e. flow variable.

Responses\:
isNull - If the key is a null pointer, i.e. the flow variable doesn't have an assigned value.
notNull - If some value is stored in the key, i.e the flow variable has a value assigned.
9646d097-b959-4dc4-bc7c-3d4edc7fe72b.415366a3-ecf6-4543-8375-9de229a11dcd.description=
Iterates through a list of values. Modifying the value of the list and delimiter inputs during iteration is not generally supported.

Inputs\:
list - The list to iterate through.
separator - A delimiter that separates elements in the list.

Returns\:
The current element of the list, if the response is has more

Responses\:
has more - Another value was in the list, and has been returned.
has no more - The iterator has gone fully through the list. This response will only be returned once per iteration through the list, a subsequent call to the Iterator will restart the Iteration through the list.
failure - failed to process the list.

Note\: Where the iterator is in the list is tracked by each step's unique id. Therefore you can iterate on the same list from multiple steps simultaneously.

WARNING\: Any step that will use the results of this Iterator operation will, by default, attempt to assign that step's inputs from a flow variable. If this is left checked, then the first element of the iterator will be used for every cycle of iteration.
9646d097-b959-4dc4-bc7c-3d4edc7fe72b.44430d26-1fa8-444a-ac86-85e72f6c7b7c.description=Counts from one number to another number. 
Inputs\:
count - number of loops to complete
reset - If true, then the counter will restart counting from the beginning.

Returns\:
The number that was just counted.

Responses\:
has more - Not yet done counting.
no more - Done counting. This will only be returned once, then counting restarts.
failure - Something went wrong.
9646d097-b959-4dc4-bc7c-3d4edc7fe72b.629ce32c-bac8-491e-ae2a-8059df9b2a81.description=
Checks if a number or word is equal to another number or word. Word comparison is case-sensitive in alphabetical order.

Inputs\:
value1 - the first value.
value2 - the second value.

Returns\:
value1 \=\= value2

Responses\:
success - The boolean operation was evaluated to true.
failure - Something went wrong or the boolean operation returned false.
9646d097-b959-4dc4-bc7c-3d4edc7fe72b.6b7d6c78-a1f9-4ff0-9494-a7b868e6c55c.prompt=Enter a value for serverId 9646d097-b959-4dc4-bc7c-3d4edc7fe72b.917dafb7-a7a7-4aa6-9c9f-9addbbb3699f.description=
This is an operation that does nothing. It can be used for filtering flow variables by feeding them in as inputs and filtering them on the results tab.

Inputs\:
field1 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
field2 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
field3 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
field4 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.

Responses\:
success - this operation never fails.
9646d097-b959-4dc4-bc7c-3d4edc7fe72b.ab651bd2-9aae-493d-9f74-6af1513e258c.description=
Checks if a number or word is equal to another number or word. Word comparison is case-sensitive in alphabetical order.

Inputs\:
value1 - the first value.
value2 - the second value.

Returns\:
value1 \=\= value2

Responses\:
success - The boolean operation was evaluated to true.
failure - Something went wrong or the boolean operation returned false.
9646d097-b959-4dc4-bc7c-3d4edc7fe72b.be7f54af-44f1-4c2c-89b1-1ef4b9776b27.description=Starts a full remediation on the specified server. If wait is specified, this operation will wait for the remediation to complete. Inputs\: coreHost - The DNS name or IP Address of your SAS core. corePort - The port to Connect to your SAS core on. coreProtocol - The protocol to connect to your SAS core with. Either HTTP or HTTPS. coreUsername - The username for host. corePassword - The password for host. coreVersion - The version of SAS to use. serverName - The name of the server to remediate. serverId - The ID of the server to remediate. If this input is provided, then the server name is ignored. wait - An integer value specifying how many milliseconds should be waited for the job to finish. If not specified the job is started, but may not have finished. rebootOption - Reboot Option for Remediating a server. It could be one of [suppress, per_action, at_end] or it can be left blank. Where\: - suppress - Suppress all reboots; - per_action - Reboot after each installation or uninstallation; - at_end - Reboot at the end of remediation; - left blank (no value provided) - Reboot as specified by individual software items. ticketID - The ticket ID for this job. If not specified it will be set default value\: 'Remediation started by SA user from OO server 'host_address' Responses\: success - The operation completed successfully. failure - Something went wrong. Returns\: returnResult - The id of the created job. 9646d097-b959-4dc4-bc7c-3d4edc7fe72b.c2347fc5-a35a-4677-bb2a-609446d8364a.prompt=Enter a value for ticketID
flow.name: SA_Manual_Remediate
